title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1220.10 - Permission to use terminal conditional
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1220.10 - Permission to use terminal conditional

State Regulations

Any permission granted by the Port Authority directly
or indirectly, expressly or by implication, to any person or persons to enter
upon or use the terminal or any part thereof, is conditioned upon acceptance of
and compliance with the Port Authority rules and regulations, and entry upon or
into the terminal by any person shall be deemed to constitute an agreement by
such person to comply with the said rules and regulations; provided, however, that such rules and regulations will not apply to premises or space occupied or
used under the provisions of a written agreement made with the Port Authority
unless provision is made therein for the application of the said rules and
regulations. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1220.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
